OperatorStr2: 2nd Floor, Sun Life Plaza West Towe

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Terminal is subject to 40 CFR part 68 for Regulated Flammable Substance (Butane). The Terminal will have six (6) vessels that contain 120,000 gallons (600,000 pounds) each. The butane is used for injecting into crude oil thus blending the oil to a desired viscosity. The facility has extensive operating procedures covering all facets of the operation and utilizes open-path gas detection throughout the facility to monitor for early release of flammable substances. 



A worst-case scenario involving the complete loss of one (1) butane vessel was modeled and resulted in an impact distance of 0.7 miles. an Alternate scenario which involved the complete loss of all six (6) butane vessels was modeled which resulted in a 1.2-mile impacted radius. A rupture or leak of the pipeline between the butane vessels and blending injectors will be confined to the facility with a 0.1-mile radius.



The Terminal is a new facility and does not have any previous spills or releases. The Terminal has developed extensive Facility Response Plans (FRP), Emergency Action Plans EAP), and Spill Prevention and Countermeasure Controls (SPCC) that are available as stand-alone documents. 



The Terminal will coordinate response needs with Local Emergency Planning and Response Organizations to determine how the stationary source is addressed in the Community Emergency Response Plan and to ensure that Local Response Organizations are aware of the regulated substances at the Terminal, their quantities, the risks presented by covered processes, and the resources and capabilities at the Terminal to respond to an accidental release of a regulated substance. Coordination will occur at least annually, and more frequently if necessary, to address changes at the stationary source; in the Terminal's Emergency Response and/or Emergency Action Plan; and/or in the Community Emergency Response Plan.



Coordination will include providing to the Local Emergency Planning and Response Organizations the Terminal

's Emergency Response Plan, Emergency Action Plan; updated emergency contact information; and other information necessary for developing and implementing the Local Emergency Response Plan. For responding stationary sources, coordination will also include consulting with Local Emergency Response Officials to establish appropriate schedules and plans for field and tabletop exercises. The Terminal will request an opportunity to meet with the Local Emergency Planning Committee (or equivalent) and/or local fire department as appropriate to review and discuss those materials.
